# Additional Resources {-}

This chapter provides curated resources to help you get the most out of NULISAseq data analysis, including package documentation, R programming tutorials, visualization tools, and technical references.

## NULISAseq Resources {- #nulisaseq-resources}

### Package Documentation {-}

The NULISAseqR package includes comprehensive documentation accessible directly from R:

```{r package-docs, eval=FALSE}
# Overall package documentation
?NULISAseqR

# Function-specific help
?importNULISAseq      # Data import
?lmNULISAseq          # Linear modeling
?lmerNULISAseq        # Linear mixed effect modeling
?lmNULISAseq_predict  # Single-protein predictive modeling with lm
?glmNULISAseq         # Generalized linear modeling
?generate_heatmap     # Heatmap visualization
?generate_pca         # PCA visualization
?volcanoPlot          # Volcano plot visualization
?render_QC_report     # QC report generation
```

### GitHub Repository {-}

[**NULISAseqR on GitHub**](https://github.com/Alamar-Biosciences/NULISAseqR){target="_blank"}

The GitHub repository includes:

- Latest package source code
- Example datasets and workflows
- Issue tracker for bug reports and feature requests

### Support and Issues {-}

- **Report bugs**: [GitHub Issues](https://github.com/Alamar-Biosciences/NULISAseqR/issues){target="_blank"}

- **Ask questions**: Use GitHub Discussions or contact [Alamar Biosciences support](mailto:support@alamarbio.com)

## NULISA Analysis Software (NAS) {- #nulisa-analysis-software-nas}

<img src="figures/NAS.png" style="width:100%; max-width:800px; border: 1px solid #ddd; margin: 20px 0;">

**NULISA Analysis Software (NAS)** is Alamar Biosciences' proprietary web-based platform for processing and analyzing NULISAseq data. <br>

NAS provides an intuitive interface for:

- **Automated data processing**: XML data file to NULISA Protein Quantification (NPQ) units and absolute quantification units (for multiplex AQ assays)
- **Quality control**: Comprehensive QC metrics and visualization
- **Interactive analysis**: Real-time exploration of protein expression data
- **Report generation**: Automated QC and differential abundance analysis reports
- **Data export**: Download processed data in various formats

NAS streamlines the initial data processing workflow, allowing researchers to quickly assess data quality, visualize data, and perform statistical analysis.

**Web Platform**: [NULISA Analysis Software (NAS)](https://analysis.alamarbio.com){target="_blank"} <br>
**NAS Overview Video**: [NULISA Analysis Software (NAS) Training](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sS8oB8suRBk){target="_blank"} <br>
**Access Required**: Contact [Alamar Biosciences support team](mailto:support@alamarbio.com) to request an account <br>
**Support**: For NAS technical support or questions, contact [Alamar Biosciences support](mailto:support@alamarbio.com) <br>

## Technical Documentation {- #technical-documentation}

#### NULISAseq Technology Technical Notes {-} 

[View Technical Notes](https://alamarbio.com/support-center/search/?type=tech-notes&category=data-analysis){target="_blank"}

- **Information Sheet - NULISAseq<sup>TM</sup> Lot and Batch Definitions**  
  Definitions of lot and batch structures, validation data, and experimental design considerations for NULISAseq assays

- **Tech Note - Performing relative quantitation of high-plex NULISAseq data**  
  NULISA data normalization, NPQ calculations, and statistical approaches used for relative quantification in multiplex NULISAseq<sup>TM</sup> assays

- **Tech Note - NULISA<sup>TM</sup> multiplex normalization & quality control**  
  NPQ calculation steps, plate-level quality control metrics and additional normalization strategies for NULISAseq<sup>TM</sup> multiplex assays

- **Tech Note - Capturing 12 logs dynamic range using NULISAseq**  
  Describes the assay tuning method incorporated by Alamar into NULISAseq<sup>TM</sup> panels to achieve broad dynamic range

- **Tech Note - Determining the Absolute Concentration of High-Plex NULISAseq Protein Targets**  
  Calibration methodology, sample processing steps, and validation results for absolute quantification analysis using the NULISAseq<sup>TM</sup> Inflammation Panel AQ

## R Programming Resources {- #r-resources}

### Installing R and RStudio {- #r-install}

**Required Software**:

1. **R** (the language): [Download from CRAN](https://cran.r-project.org/){target="_blank"}
   - Windows: [Direct link](https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/base/){target="_blank"}
   - macOS: [Direct link](https://cran.r-project.org/bin/macosx/){target="_blank"}
   - Linux: [Instructions](https://cran.r-project.org/bin/linux/){target="_blank"}

2. **RStudio** (the IDE): [Download from Posit](https://posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop/){target="_blank"}

**Installation Order**: Install R first, then RStudio.

#### R and RStudio Resources and Tutorials {-}

[**R for Data Science**](https://r4ds.had.co.nz/){target="_blank"} by Hadley Wickham and Garrett Grolemund  

- Comprehensive introduction to the tidyverse
- Data import, wrangling, visualization, and modeling
- Free online book with exercises

[**Hands-On Programming with R**](https://rstudio-education.github.io/hopr/){target="_blank"} by Garrett Grolemund  

- Beginner-friendly introduction to R programming
- Learn by building R projects
- Covers R basics, data structures, and functions

[**RStudio Education**](https://education.rstudio.com/){target="_blank"}

- Curated learning resources
- Cheat sheets for R packages
- Interactive tutorials

#### Quick Reference Guides {-}

[**R Cheat Sheets**](https://www.rstudio.com/resources/cheatsheets/){target="_blank"}

- Base R
- Data transformation (dplyr)
- Data visualization (ggplot2)
- R Markdown
- And many more

### Tidyverse Resources {-}

The tidyverse is essential for data manipulation and analysis in this book:

[**Tidyverse Website**](https://www.tidyverse.org/){target="_blank"}  

- Package documentation
- Learning resources
- Blog with tips and updates

[**dplyr Documentation**](https://dplyr.tidyverse.org/){target="_blank"}  

- Data manipulation verbs
- Working with grouped data
- Joining datasets

[**tidyr Documentation**](https://tidyr.tidyverse.org/){target="_blank"}  

- Reshaping data (pivot_longer, pivot_wider)
- Handling missing values
- Nesting and unnesting data

## Data Visualization Resources {- #visualization-resources}

### ggplot2 {-}

ggplot2 is the primary visualization package used throughout this book.

[**ggplot2 Official Documentation**](https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org/){target="_blank"}  

- Complete reference for all geoms and functions
- Articles on faceting, scales, themes, and extensions

[**ggplot2: Elegant Graphics for Data Analysis**](https://ggplot2-book.org/){target="_blank"} by Hadley Wickham  

- Comprehensive guide to ggplot2
- Theory and practice of the grammar of graphics
- Advanced customization techniques

[**R Graphics Cookbook**](https://r-graphics.org/){target="_blank"} by Winston Chang  

- Recipe-style solutions for common plotting tasks
- Quick reference for plot types and customizations

[**ggplot2 Extensions Gallery**](https://exts.ggplot2.tidyverse.org/){target="_blank"}  

- Showcase of ggplot2 extension packages
- Specialized plot types and themes

### ComplexHeatmap {-}

ComplexHeatmap is a powerful package for creating sophisticated heatmaps, extensively used in proteomics visualization.

[**ComplexHeatmap Complete Reference**](https://jokergoo.github.io/ComplexHeatmap-reference/book/){target="_blank"}  

- Comprehensive guide to all features
- Examples for every visualization type
- Advanced customization options

[**ComplexHeatmap Bioconductor Page**](https://bioconductor.org/packages/ComplexHeatmap/){target="_blank"}  

- Installation instructions
- Official documentation
- Vignettes and examples

### PCAtools {-}

PCAtools provides enhanced PCA visualization and analysis capabilities.

**PCAtools**  
Alamar Biosciences fork of PCAtools by Kevin Blighe and Aaron Lun includes NULISAseq-specific features.
[View on GitHub](https://github.com/Alamar-Biosciences/PCAtools){target="_blank"}

```{r install-pcatools, eval=FALSE}
# Install version
devtools::install_github("Alamar-Biosciences/PCAtools")
```

[*Original package*](https://github.com/kevinblighe/PCAtools){target="_blank"}

[**PCAtools Bioconductor Page**](https://bioconductor.org/packages/PCAtools/){target="_blank"}

- Comprehensive PCA analysis functions
- Scree plots, biplots, and loading plots
- Statistical tests for optimal PC selection

## Citing This Book and Packages {- #citations}

### Citing This Book {-}
```
Alamar Biosciences Bioinformatics Team. (`r format(Sys.Date(), "%Y")`). NULISAseq Data Analysis Guide. 
R package vignette for NULISAseqR. Available at: https://vignettes.nulisaseqr.alamarbio.com
```

### Citing R and Packages {-}

```{r citations, eval=FALSE}
# Cite R
citation()

# Cite specific packages
citation("NULISAseqR")
citation("ggplot2")
citation("ComplexHeatmap")
citation("PCAtools")

# Generate citation list for all loaded packages
knitr::write_bib(
  c(.packages(), "bookdown", "knitr", "rmarkdown"),
  file = "packages.bib"
)
```
